reviews.text: Fantastic place to visit with the family. Full of history and authenticity. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, they organize events for all ages. Well maintained and easy to walk around, access to the second floor is by stairs only. I liked the main hallway decorations and the comments around the house with interesting information.
Our tour guide Cathy was very knowledgeable, each visit is always unique and filled with little gems.
Fantastic education tour with our Sparks & Brownies.  Facilitators kept the learning age-appropriate, fun and engaging.
Great place to visit! You need at least an hour to visit the entire house. If you are interested about the details you need one more hour :)

I recently went to a "winter tea" where my partner won a "behind the ropes tour".  A representative from Eldon House called to tell us this and informed us that we would be receiving our tickets through e-mail for the 20th of January.  This was over a month ago.  When we called to try to inquire as to the status of this, we never received a call back/answer.  Definitely a little disappointing.

Its a wonderful park with something for everyone. It has a great children's playground, with everything you would expect, with swings, sliders...sand pits, climbing frames and more challenging things for bigger kids...there is a skateboard park, and a duck pond. There are gardens full of flowers to enjoy, tennis,bowls and golf, put and play and crazy golf..tea shops toilets and ice cream and a bandstand

Probably the most amazing free outdoor children’s park I’ve ever been to. The range of equipment is vast! Several wonderful jungle gyms, with slides varying from beginners level all the way to this humongous tunnel slide which actually I’d quite like to get on myself!! 

With sandpits and climbing walls, a zip wire and so many swings, two double swings (for two children or an adult and a little one) one fully backed swing, lots of regular ones and even two of those big circle rope ones. 

There is also a cafe with toilets attached however I believe there is a charge for these so bring change.

There is also a nice ratio of sunny to shaded areas.

I’d happily bring the children here one morning with picnic blankets and food and spend the whole day !!

We had very nice time walking around the park. It's big, it's beautiful and have a lot of space for activities. Just take your blanket and picnic basket and head to Victoria Park for a lovely day :)
And Botanical Garden next to it is just magical. Perfect place to spend a day enjoying great weather, beautiful area and walking.

Lovely park for a wall and some fresh air. 
Had a picnic by the duck  pond, with my baby. Lots of ducks for children to feed. Lovely and clean, no litter anywhere,  lots  of benches to sit on.
We never went in the park, as my baby is only 11 weeks, but in time, we will. 
We'll  be back
Fabulous park, something for everyone. Family friendly play area which has a huge range of play equipment for all ages. Also love the botanic gardens and big open spaces for picnics
The menu was extensive, the food was delicious and the portions were great.  We absolutely loved the place.  Service was great too!!
My daughter and I went there last night.. Wow!  Great selection of vegetarian options, and food as well as the atmosphere was just awesome. My new favorite restaurant.
GREAT FOOD !! They keep the place Very Clean and the staff and the staff are Top Shelf. You won't be disappointed.
Great atmosphere, prompt service, plenty of basil.  Would have loved getting a bit more actual meat in my bowl of pho.
Took way too long and service was decent for the food.

Cozy and elegant place, friendly service and yummy food. Me and my date ordered The stuffed jalapenos for appetizers, then I ordered The duck breast for entree and we shared the dessert, which was The dark chocolate truffle brownie with home made icecream. The jalapenos were extremely delicious!! The duck breast was a little bit undercooked and I requested to get it cooked more, I got another piece of the meat with no fuss! And the dessert excellent. 😊

My first time here and I loved their Jerk Hen dish! Their stuffed jalepeños are a must try! The service is attentive and friendly. The atmosphere is cozy and elegant. I plan to return. Be prepared to spend $$$
Great food, good location, good service. It can be a bit crowded at times. Overall is nice place for dinner.

A most pleasant dining experience overall. Fried Brie and Mussels appetizers were outstanding. Service was excellent. Main course for both of us was the seafood pasta. Mine was delicious.lots of seafood. A very tasty sauce and pasta perfectly done. Sadly my wife's pasta arrived without any sauce making it dry and pretty tasteless. Server was quick to take it back once we got her attention and had 'some' sauce added. This improved her dish, but by that time I was nearly finished. Too bad this happened, did not expect such a faux pas at the BT. Also if you sit at the back near the patio in winter, wear a jacket- very cool.

I appreciate the atmosphere. It's cozy but elegant too. The service is responsive and kind. My date asked for the duck breast to be recooked well-done and they did so with out a fuss and without much delay. The alcohol menu is very expanisve! We loved the stuffed jalepeños and this a recommended must try! My jerk hen dish was delicious! As a fist timer here: I can definitely say I'll return again. Thanks for the great service! 😁
I was fine I suppose. Nice selection of food. Quality wasn't bad. But not worth $36 a person in my opinion. Service staff very slow. Waited 30 min for the bill after asking for it!

We went for breakfast this morning and both had the eggs Benedict. My wife had the regular bacon one and I had the salmon Benedict. Since we were celebrating we ordered a waffle and split it for desert. Overall the food was a 4-4.5 but the service made it a 5 star. The place has a nice ambiance.
Sunday Brunch is worth the price! Unbeatable selection and quality. Our servers were very attentive and constantly refilled our coffee and water. Definitely a place to go and treat yourself!!!

I sometimes take the train to London very early in the morning and treat myself to a breakfast at the Armouries. Good menu items, generous portions and reasoonably priced, good service in a modern, well maintained space.  I recommend the Eggs Benedict.

Based on Sunday Brunch That is offered here:
The food is always exceptional! Great place to have brunch with family & friends. This place is good for folks with diverse needs:
Good for small and large parties
Selection of vegetarian and vegan food
Accessible for people with physical limitations (wheel chairs, walkers, walking sticks, etc)
Staff are great
Parking is available on nearby streets
Can pickup and drop off right at front door
Good for small children as well as adults 
Nice and casual environment
Very clean and setup is nice

The food here is excellent, absolutely authentic and hearty. It is the type of place you can sit at for hours, and the kitchen staff will come out and chat with you about the history of the food and how its made. Best south American and Caribbean food I have ever had in Canada

Loved everything about this restaurant! The food was very flavourful and the service was good, especially for a freshly cooked meal. My family and I will definitely be back to enjoy another dinner from Jambalaya.

This is hands down my favourite restaurant in London. The food is second to none, and the staff are very laid back and awesome. People complain about the time that it takes to get your food on a lot of reviews, but come on, its a small restaurant and all of the food is literally made from scratch, if you walk to the washroom you can even see all of the skillets prepped for each individual dish! I seize any opportunity I can to go to this place, and as a vegetarian there are plenty of tasty options, just don't make plans for afterwards as the portion sizes are gigantic.

Great food- Highly recommend the chicken yaya and the beef fajitas-owner/head chef was a really nice guy who came out an introduced himself to us. would totally suggest this place for people coming in from out of town or special occasions-

What can I say but wow for over 13 years and I am always delighted to have my favourite dish Jambalaya Stew which creates a mulititude of exploding flavours-ingredients are fresh and cooked too perfection-and I just never ever get tired of it and look forward to the next time like a child in a candy store...

But wait I do try other menu items and for those who appreciate what calamari should taste like this is the only restaurant since leaving out west 26 years ago that can make it so it melts in your mouth with flavour that will keep you coming back and not like a stick of gum chewy with no flavour which seems to be the trend at other locations...

My wife and the friends we invite have tried a mulitude of items and always come back with the same comment of great portions-the flavours...oh the flavours homemade and done with pride not once-not twice-but each and every time...we have tried many locations and the consistency of the experience is always here and keeps us coming back and bringing friends each time with confidence and pride...

The service is always great and remember that each dish is made with pride so it might take a couple of minutes more but wait...what is the rush....enjoy a place that wants you to relax and enjoy the experience rather than "when are they leaving so we can get two more table turn overs"...remember the days when pride of the product outways the rush and enjoy a culinary experience at a price level that does not match with the value you receive...

Did I mention I was in the restaurant business for over 20 years-an owner myself-and a gm at a few large chain restaurants-only mention this because my expectations are hard to meet and each time they do at Jambalaya....

So do yourself a favour...not for you but your tastebuds...so be selfish this one time and you will return again...allow yourself this treat of having a food experience that will have your tastebuds explode with excitement...your stomach full and content...and maybe if you allow yourself in a world that is always rushing and things have to be done a minute ago slow down-take a deep breath-be part of an experience that will place a smile on your face and a little relaxation creeps into your life....

Enjoy the moment- we always do and have learned to slow down just for that moment and have always been rewarded...

First time ordering food by delivery from this place. Cost 63.38$ , the receipt they gave us had no detail as to what we were paying for , and the food quantity was not worth the money. It took over an hour to get to my house and dumplings had no filling, pork cutlets were folded on top of itself and too much rice, not enough of everything else. I probably wouldn't order again.

Came here when it was pretty empty on a weekend. Ordered the black bean sauce noodles and the tteokbokki (spicy rice cake) but was disappointed by the bland and underwhelming flavour. Unfortunately, this place has to be my least favourite Korean restaurant in London.
Was a pleasant surprise. Food good but a little pricey, although portions large. I would go again.

This is a local secret, a great spot for good Korean food at good prices. I wish there were restaurants like Mana in Toronto to be honest. I miss the down-to-earth atmosphere and rustic feel to the place. It's not exciting, but it's not meant to be - solid Korean eats mixed with some Japanese dishes. A great spot to have hot pork bone soup or a hot stone bowl rice in the depths of Canadian winter. Can not recommend this place enough. It's not perfect, but there's something special about this joint!

Definitely not the best Korean food in London but decent place. Would recommend to eat tteok Bok yee (떡볶이) because it has good spicy taste and comes with a hard boiled egg. Or you could try gamjatang (감자탕) which is spicy tender beef with potato -personal favourite dish from here. They used to have really good kimchi when I first visited three years ago but it's just okay now.. I wouldn't recommend the tangsuyuk (탕수육) because the sauce is too sweet. The service is always kinda slow and sloppy because they only have one server with multiple tables occupied, which is understandable. Overall a decent place to try Korean food.

The atmosphere is elegant. We were able to attend Saturday which has amazing live music. The staff was amazing attentive funny and relatable. We had a 3 person team and again amazing people. The food was some of the best tasting food we have ever had. A true must visit.

I have had dinner here for an anniversary as well as a birthday dinner.  I enjoyed it.  The interior was very clean upscale in a dated sort of way, but nice never the less.  The food was delicious, presentation was excellent.  The service was professional and I enjoyed the sense of privacy we had at our table.  It is definitely worth a night out here.

Went with my wife and son to Michael's since I heard they were starting a new live jazz series every Thursday night. I have long felt that London needs more places to catch local jazz performers while having a beverage or two - and this was perfect. The band was a 4 piece ensemble - piano, bass, drums and trumpet (the John Griffith quartet I believe). They played for three hours and there was no cover charge! The atmosphere was excellent for live jazz (mood lighting, fireplace) and the music was so tasteful. Drinks were reasonable and we had a couple of nice appetizers. It turns out that there are a number of bands that will cycle through in this series, so I am really looking forward to hearing the other groups. I imagine once the days get longer that it will be even better as you will be able to look out over the park and listen to jazz while you have a glass of wine. Highly recommended for a Thursday night.

Definitely not a good bang for your buck. The decor and ambiance is classic but the food itself was not anything to write home about. The presentation of the food (which they make in front of you) was great for their famous cesar salad and their flambe deserts. However the cesar was too salty and soaked the romaine lettuce. The flambe was a $30 brownie with caramel on it at the end of the day. It's a great place to go to show off to someone you want to impress as a "high class socialite" but I wouldn't go there for their food.

Was here for a wedding reception. Food was excellent, start to finish. From the bread, to the salad, to the prime rib (amazing!), and the al dente vegetables and garlic mash, to dessert. Was a great dining experience. The young man at coat check even helps you with your coat! Cool! Recommend 100%.

Excellent service! We made a reservation but showed up an hour early to sit at the bar and enjoy some beverages and they were second to none. The staff behind the bar knew what they were doing and made us proper drinks. Once our table opened up we were seated right away and the service continued to be unmatched. The food - amazing, price - much less than we expected and dinner was served in a timely manner.

September 3 2016 
Had a wonderful dinner tonight! Have not been in awhile so very happy to have a meal we were used to having from the past. Let's keep it this way. 
Love you guys
Absolutely our favorite. Nice environment, not at all pretentious, with incredible food and extremely nice staff. Great quality, never tried something we didn't like!

Fabulous food, service and ambiance at The Only On King last night. A friend flew in from New Orleans on business for the day, he was extremely impressed with your restaurant. We had the Tasting Menu which was exceptional; every mouthful was scrumptious. The wine pairings perfect. A great experience for someone who comes from a city where the restaurant choices and quality are extraordinary. He was surprised at how reasonable our meal was for the quality served. Bravo!
Perfect place to grab a quick bite or watch the game, go on a date, or hang with your friendly  miles on their faces

Great service with friendly and attentive staff. We had several dishes and each was fantastic - great flavours and colors and everything I've come to expect and hope for I'm good Indian cuisine. The prices are reasonable for the amount and quality of the food and you can definitely expect to bring home some leftovers. I highly recommend this restaurant and hope to return soon!
Food is excellent. Nice atmosphere, polite and friendly staff. Great Indian meal at an affordable price. Large menu with many options available. We've never been disappointed with Raja.

I love this place. The Chicken Vindaloo is to die for! Nice assortment of flavors on the appetizer platter too.
Great atmosphere and attentive staff.
Loved the meal for two. Great sampler and left you satisfied and looking forward to your next visit. Fantastic! New meaning to take-out!

Excellent food. We had beef and lamb and the meet was nice and tender. The spices were delicious. Service was straight forward and fast, not super artificially friendly. We didn't go there to make friends. Bathroom clean.

I can not get enough of their pizza. I have had it many times and have never been disappointed. They do a name day where they pick a different name everyday to give out free slices. Some of the best pizza I have had in North America.

Friendly service, great pizza and pretty much a staple of downtown London.

Parking can be a challenge, so it's usually better to be a walk in.  It can be extremely busy after bars close but they get people in and out really quickly.

Make sure you check their Facebook page because they rotate different names every day and you might be able to get a free slice!

One of my favorite pizza stops in London.  Buy a slice or order an entire pizza, it's always delicious, hot, and ready.  I would recommend you try out this pizza over any other in the downtown  metro area.

From out of town, so zero bias. This is pretty standard football pizza. It's 'good', but definitely not worth the price. Don't really know how they're calculating their $2.00 per topping (on a medium..?) price either. Also the '12" Medium" was more like 10.5-11." It was 6 small-ish slices which is usually how a 10" small pie is cut at most pizzerias. Medium should be 8 slices if sized correctly. 

Trying not to knock them too much because it's obviously hard running a small business, but I was just expecting a higher quality product for what I paid.
Great pizza's! 22" of sexy, all up in my mouth! I can't put it any clearer than that. And they're the only ones open, talk about cornering the market

Florine, owner/head chef of Vegout, generously agreed to provide vegan entrees and vegan/diabetic-friendly strawberry cheesecakes for my recent wedding. 

Not only was the food delicious, she was an absolute dream to work with! Beyond her obvious culinary talents, she's a wonderfully compassionate and sincere individual.

My hubby and I regularly enjoy dining at her cozy, welcoming restaurant and we were so pleased we were able to share her delicious food with our wedding guests.
Our day wouldn't have been the same without her fabulous contributions!

Not Veg Out anymore.  Now called Glassroots. Amazing food.  Most of the menu was gluten free, or options for gluten free. 

Excellent atmosphere.  Thanks Glassroots!

Terrible service.
Walked in, waitress purposefully decided to ignore us and leave us standing there ungreeted.  Finally decided to say hi and but the vibe was unfriendly. Was glad to be told the restaurant was fully booked for another hourso we could leave.
First and last time there, never got to try the food but I don't care.
Creative and tasty food and great service.  We were pleasantly surprised.

If you're vegetarian or vegan and live in London and you want the option of anything on the menu this is your place. Amazing faux fish and chips, seitan sandwiches, chili cheese fries, burritos, and beverages. The wife and I come here whenever it's convenient and we love it every time.
I've had better sushi but I have also had worse sushi. not bad. good service too.

Regular, happy customer. The food is always great. They are always fun and accommodating as they can be. It’s been twelve years and never have they let me down. 
No reservations needed! 
;) 
Xoxo

This is my favorite spot for lunch! You aren't getting fresher fish anywhere in Cody. The owners are often on the floor with one acting as a server or hostess and the other making sushi behind the bar. The sushi chef will offer specials and recommendations to regulars once they learn what you like. I love trying new things so this is a big plus for me! The staff is always kind and attentive and remembers me and will even have a real conversation with me and get to know me. One of their servers was just working there for the summer and made a point to tell me bye because she was moving back home and thanked me for being her customer. I had probably the worst morning today and went here for lunch and their kindness literally turned my day around. On top of the great service the food is amazing too! All of the girls at my work rave about their sushi and I have to agree that it is amazing and the ginger salad dressing is delicious! This is a local favorite!
Great Owners, always on the floor or behind the bar making sushi. Great atmosphere, and GREAT SUSHI. Absolutely love this place and you will too!!
Great food and authentic atmosphere. Mildly dirty so that's why 4/5 stars. Service was great and owners were on the floor and very friendly and conversational.

I have been eating here since I was a kid (I'm 35). The deep-fried spring rolls are to die for. The owner and family are wonderful. Don't be fooled by the simple decor - the food is wonderful and from a first-generation Vietnamese Canadian who knows good food with classic techniques. Thanks for 25 years of fantastic dining!!!
The food: Fantastic. The service: Speedy and friendly. The portions: Huge. The price: Great. The wonderful free tea: The finishing touch to a perfect meal. Eat here. Full stop.
Food was great and cheap! They serve some nice tea as well with your meal. The staff was really friendly 😊!
I love his place! The food is always hot and fresh, the service friendly and the prices are more than reasonable. Would highly recommend!

Good service but very dirty restaurant and the most bland and basic pad Thai I've ever eaten, and I've eaten a lot of pad Thai!! I'd suggest eating elsewhere for both a cleaner environment and more flavour. There are lots of good Thai and Vietnamese restaurants in London. Thaifoon and Tamarine on Dundas are both amazing. Thai Cuisine on Gainsborough too.

Had lunch here with the fine gentlemen of Thistlewood. Good food as usual. Some beer was consumed. Somebodies hearing aid went dead. Somebody had a spare battery. A good lunch. See you next month guys or maybe at the mailbox.

Stop by each year while at a conference hosted in town.  I love this place.  It's so cozy and the waitstaff is great!  I recognize faces each year so the restaurant is doing something right to retain their waitstaff.
Great food, great service! I can never make up my mind for drink and I just tell the bartender to pick something for me! He always makes the most amazing drinks!
Good food, good atmosphere...only thing was that the soft drinks were a tad low on fizz but besides that, I enjoyed my experience
Awesome atmosphere, great menu and relaxed staff!  Love this place for dinners!

Amazing burgers, cooked to perfection.  Their Green Flash IPA on tap us my go to beer.  Their fries are amazing and one of the few places that offer steak cut fries (and get that fresh garlic on it).  Anytime I'm on Solano and need a good burger, i look no further.  Always friendly staff and even when its busy, you get your food in a timely manner.  Love this place!

An excellent showing by a community based restaurant.  We shall start with the service.  It was good... bordering on excellent.  Ambiance was nice.  Food was excellent and plentiful. The voodoo sauce mixed with blue cheese added depth and fantastic sneak up on you heat. The large fry fed 3 people with left overs. All in all a solid good meal.  I will return.

Received attentive, if not nervous like, service and serving classically good Barney's Burgers  food. 
Perhaps it was the layout, the old athmosphere, the overly strong clinging perfume smell or the sticky feeling on the table but I cannot see myself returning to this particular Barney's on Solano.
So very good.  Best burger joint in the bay area

Barney's makes some of the best burgers I've had. Consistently. It's hard to describe exactly what they do so right, except that they capture the essence of an American burger. The classic Barney's Burger is big, juicy, slightly blackened, with fresh lettuce, tomato, and onion, on a perfect sesame bun. It's not edgy and over the top like a $25 artisanal gastropub burger. It's just damned good, and I keep coming back.
